Keywords: Avengers , X-Men
Real Name: Anna Marie LeBeau
Special Powers
WONDER MANâ€™S IONIC STABILITY: Steal Energy. // When Rogue hits, after resolutions you may choose a printed combat value on one of the hit targets. If you do, until you choose again, replace the same combat value on Rogue with the chosen combat value.

Comments
January 3, 2022
Dortmuner
[QUOTE=Goop;12168828]The problem with Rogue here is you have to pick a stat AFTER you hit. So you likely knocked them off their 11atk or 18def before you now get to choose. Not a very well designed piece. I dont think traited steal energy makes up for low stats at 60pts.[/QUOTE] Good point. The power triggers off a hit rather than damage, so you could actually find yourself in a situation where you're hoping your victim Masterminds the damage to someone else. Or you're Quaking people with reducers so they reduce to 0 damage and you get their good combat value. And then they get to smack you before you can use them. You do get to keep the value until you choose again, though, so that's nice. Even if she gets damaged and her other values decrease, the one she stole stays put.
January 3, 2022
Dortmuner
[QUOTE=muel0017;12173725]It's Rogue, her shtick is stealing abilities upon contact, unless something with her has changed in the last, well ever, she doesn't get them before contact.[/QUOTE] He's not talking comic accuracy, he's talking game mechanics and functionality. It looks like a good power until you consider that when you hit your opponent, you often times knock them to a click with smaller combat values. So when you hit something that starts off on click 1 with an 11 attack, 4 damage and you damage them to click 2 or 3 where they have 19 attack, three damage, it diminishes the usefulness of the power because you knocked them to the exact same combat values she already has on most of your dial. It's a reasonable point and does point out a diminished usefulness of the power.
January 2, 2022
VictorySaber
muel0017, that's JUST IT THO. She steals powers. abilities. those represented by what on the dial? the POWERS! Not raw stats numbers. Whoever came up with this one didn't seem to understand that. but they were probably afraid of repeating the same style design they'd used on her previously... but frankly? I'd have been FINE with that! That's the kind if additional utility I'd expect from the X-Men's finest flying brick that can smack ya down

Not a very well designed piece. I dont think traited steal energy makes up for low stats at 60pts.[/QUOTE] It's Rogue, her shtick is stealing abilities upon contact, unless something with her has changed in the last, well ever, she doesn't get them before contact.
December 8, 2021
The Singularity
I'd throw her on a team for that cost, But I wish she had at least one starting click of SS instead of quake.
December 7, 2021
bgreyloc
This is a pretty good piece. Steeling a stat is a side note. Early dial she can diversify her combat with quake, which give her more chances to heal, and she's a hammer late dial. Put her as a 1,2 punch with that wolverine, and make her a finisher.
November 30, 2021
Goop
The problem with Rogue here is you have to pick a stat AFTER you hit. So you likely knocked them off their 11atk or 18def before you now get to choose. Not a very well designed piece. I dont think traited steal energy makes up for low stats at 60pts.
